content: puffed headband materials ● caron simply soft of any size 4 yarn i used the color jupiter ● 4 5mm hook stitches and abbreviations ● chain chain ● ps puff yarn over and insert your hook into the same ​ space yarn over again and pull up a long loop three more ​ ​ times you should now have 9 loops on your hook yarn over ​ ​ and pull through all 9 loops on your hook chain 1 to close ​ ​ ● chain space chain space the space in between stitches sizing this pattern is made for an average adult female about 21 unstretched but can be adjusted by adding or removing more row to the end take a look at the chart by crochetncrafts com for help adjusting your pattern notes ● other than the first row where you will be creating puff stitches in the chain all puff stitches are made in the spaces in between puffs not on top the final puff is in between the chain 2 and the first puff ● make sure your initial chain is loose or it will be very difficult to get the puffs in ● change the thickness by shortening the initial chain ● change the length by adding or removing row at the end pattern row 1 loosely chain 9 ps in the 3rd chain from hook and across chain 2 turn 7 puff stitches row 2 ps in each chain space note the last ps goes between the ps and the chain 2 chain 2 turn 7 row 3 repeat row 2 until desired length mine was 43 total row when you are happy with the length continue to finish finish slip_stitch across to connect the beginning to ending sides be careful not to twist your headband tie off and sew loose ends that s it you re done please show off your new headband i d love to see it
